channel.title: rstats tidyverse on R, it's OK I guess
channel.description: Recent content in rstats tidyverse on R, it's OK I guess

item.title: Dates and lubridate
item.description: Did somebody say dates? Well, actually not those. I meant the other kind. Some birth dates Let’s suppose that we have some people and their birth dates, and we want to know how old they are: cat dates.csv ## date,date_words,id ## 2007-09-04,September 4 2007,M ## 1963-09-24,September 24 1963,Dad ## 1970-06-01,June 1 1970,Mom There are three people (who may or may not be real), and their birth dates are expressed two ways, once as year-month-day, and once in English with month names.

item.title: On crossing the rubicon, or how never to use expand.grid again
item.description: Packages The usual: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1.9000 ✔ purrr 0.2.4 ## ✔ tibble 1.4.2 ✔ dplyr 0.7.4 ## ✔ tidyr 0.7.2 ✔ stringr 1.2.0 ## ✔ readr 1.1.1 ✔ forcats 0.2.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() Introduction Let’s use some data on Australian elite athletes, which can be found here:
